title: 'Software glitch' halts online transactions of cooperative sector banks
description: A software glitch has disrupted online transactions at nearly 300 banks across India for the past three days, primarily affecting cooperative banks. The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) suspects a ransomware attack and has temporarily isolated the software. The issue, linked to 'C-Edge' software by TCS and SBI, has caused problems with RTGS and UPI payments. Banks, including 17 in Gujarat, are awaiting restoration as the RBI works to resolve the issue.
